heading: frozen assets
subheading: ben and jerry, those nice vermont fellas who serve up a helping of social consciousness along with their tasty ice cream, are on the horns of a dilemma. idealism is one thing, but ben and jerry's company trades on the nasdaq, the stock has been flat, and the shareholders must be fed. that's why the company is reportedly a legitimate takeover target from any number of potential suitors, including at least one other ice cream company. in a perfect world, of course, idealism would win out, and the shareholders would take their 24 bucks a share, join hands, and sing "kumbaya." alas, the world is not perfect.
